sentences.en: But this is a matter only for conjecture , things having gone otherwise that he forecast.
sentences.cn: 可是这只是猜测而已, 事情跟他的预料恰恰相反.

sentences.en: He conjectured that some individuals may be able to detect major calamities.
sentences.cn: 他推测有些人也许能察觉到重大灾难。

sentences.en: I was right in my conjecture [ guess ] .
No conjecture can be offered on the subject.
sentences.cn: 关于这个问题不可臆测.

sentences.en: Now that their breakup had reached this stage, was this conjecture still worth verifying?
sentences.cn: 彼此决裂到这个田地, 这猜想还值得证实 么 ?

sentences.en: She didn't know the facts; what she said was pure conjecture.
sentences.cn: 她并不知道实情, 她所说的纯属猜测.

sentences.en: That was a conjecture, not a fact.
The attitudes of others were matters of conjecture although there were plenty of rumours about how individuals had behaved.
sentences.cn: 尽管对个人的表现存在很多谣传，但他人的看法还只是一些猜测。

sentences.en: The rumour raised a storm of conjecture.
sentences.cn: 这谣言引起了一阵猜测.

sentences.en: There has been some conjecture about a possible merger.
sentences.cn: 有人猜测公司可能会合并。

sentences.en: This conjecture is not supported by any real evidence.
sentences.cn: 这种推测未被任何确切的证据所证实.

sentences.en: This conjecture is not well founded.
Two mathematicians claimed to have proved the conjecture.
sentences.cn: 两位数学家声称已经证实了该猜想.
是什麽促使你推测出这样的结论?

sentences.en: What she said was pure conjecture .

phrases.tran_cn: 哥德巴赫猜想（任何比2大的偶数都是两质数的和）

trans.tran_cn: 推测，猜想，设想，揣度，想像，计划
trans.tran_en: when you form ideas or opinions without having very much information to base them on
to form an idea or opinion without having much information to base it on
when you form ideas or opinions without having very much information to base them on

trans.tran_cn: 推测，猜想，估量，揣摩，设想
